medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain worsened with movement for 24 hours.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Abdominal pain began 2 days ago, described as a bar pain that worsened with movement. The patient experienced nausea and vomiting one week prior, which he initially thought was due to a kidney stone, but was evaluated by a urologist who dismissed that diagnosis.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Coronary artery disease, hypothyroidism, hypercholesterolemia, colonic polyps, sleep disorder, unstable angina, pre-diabetes, mercury elevation history, vitamin D insufficiency, hyperparathyroidism.
medical_history.family_history: Both parents were alcoholics; mother died of CVA; father died of cirrhosis at age 76; brother also had alcohol use disorder.
